title: Intelligent Tutoring Agent-Based Strategy for Optimizing Social and Cognitive Load in Students with Learning Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Basic learning sciences, cognitive load theory, and foundational concepts related to special education (learning disabilities)
context.additional_context: Design of personalized online learning environments considering characteristics of learning disabilities (dyscalculia). Enhanced smartphone-based accessibility and real-time interaction supporting social relationship formation. Focus on implementing inclusive learning environments within educational systems.

learning_goals: Identify cognitive load types (intrinsic/extraneous/germane) and social interaction factors in students with learning disabilities with 80% accuracy.
Analyze the impact of intelligent tutoring agents on learning effectiveness, knowledge retention, and social skill development using quantitative metrics.
Design at least three strategies to minimize extraneous cognitive load based on learner characteristics (including dyscalculia), considering cultural contexts.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
